newsitem.title: USA: AgrEvo says court dismisses DeKalb case.
newsitem.headline: AgrEvo says court dismisses DeKalb case.

text.p: AgrEvo USA Co said Wednesday that the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois has suspended a patent suit brought against AgrEvo by DeKalb Genetics Corp involving corn seed.
AgrEvo said DeKalb had alleged that LibertyLink corn, a type of corn which AgrEvo claims to have developed, infringed on DeKalb's patent.
"This ruling reinforces our conviction that LibertyLink corn is the intellectual property of AgrEvo and that DeKalb's claims to ownership will be ultimately rejected," AgrEvo said in a statement.

AgrEvo said LibertyLink corn is being launched this year in the U.S. through a network of nearly 100 seed companies. It said the corn is a hybrid made tolerant to a broad spectrum of herbicide through biotechnology.
